bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to Alvey A. Adee
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General
Second Assistant U.S. Secretary of State

div1.ab:
Consulate General, U. S. A.
Monrovia, Liberia, May 18th 1889

Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith
To the Department of State.
div1.p:
Despatch No 7 received,
Receipt for parcel from B. F. Stevens,
Parcel not received.
div1.ab:
Consulate General, U. S. A.
Monrovia, Liberia, May 18th 1889

Honorable Alvey A. Adee,
Second Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D. C.
div1.p: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of your No 7, under date April 2nd, informing me that a supply of the articles requested for the Consular Agent at Elmina, in my Despatch No 16 of Feb'y 28th last had been ordered to be sent to this office.

I received by the same mail which brought your despatch, a receipt from Mr. B. F. Stevens for one parcel, shipped per the steamer Niger, for this Consulate General, but the parcel was not landed by said steamer, which was in port on the 13th inst.

I am, sir,
Your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith,
U.S. Consul Gen'l.
